attributes.action: Return MP's second homes to the state when the MP is no longer an MP.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Why do we pay for a second home for MPs to be closer to Parliament? Which they then sell off and pocket the money when they retire or end their term at Parliament. Surely these houses once paid for should remain property of the state? Ending the endless burden of mortgage repayments on expenses and providing housing for new members? Just have to look how No10 is handed down.. So we are asking for the government to bring the second home for MPs back into state control and not to be a cash cow for their retirement at the expense of us all...

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
